name: Dummy Deck
description: Sandbox for testing new technical phrases before migration.

cards.sideA: No quise llegar tan lejos.

sideB.text: I didn't mean to go that far.
I didn't intend to take it that far.
It wasn't my intention to go so far.
I didn't want to go that far.
I didn't want to go too far.
I didn't mean to go too far.

cards.sideA: ¿Quién está en la cima de la jerarquía?.

sideB.text: Who is at the top of the hierarchy?
Who stands at the hierarchy's summit?
Who is at the hierarchy peak?

cards.sideA: Necesitas respetar la jerarquía de la empresa.

sideB.text: You need to respect the company hierarchy.
You must respect the corporate hierarchy.
You have to respect the hierarchy of the company.

cards.sideA: Entran todos, a excepción del #45

sideB.text: Everything is included, except for #45.
All of them go in, with the exception of #45.
Every single one is coming in, excluding #45.

cards.note: [Everything] or [All of them] is used for objects. [Everyone] is strictly for people. Use [Every single one] when you want to emphasize each individual item in a set.

cards.sideA: Ya no estamos usando ese procedimiento.

sideB.text: We are no longer using that procedure.
We aren't using that procedure anymore.
That procedure is no longer in use.
We don't use that procedure any longer.
We no longer use that procedure.

cards.note:
**[24]**

~We no loger use that procedure~ is incorrect due to the spelling of [longer] and because the structure requires the adverb to be placed correctly relative to the verb.

cards.sideA: Decidí no actualizar el servidor esta noche.

sideB.text: I decided not to update the server tonight.
I chose to not update the server tonight.
I made the decision not to update the server tonight.

cards.note:
**[188]**

[Not to update] is the correct way to negate the secondary action 'update' after the main verb [decided].

cards.sideA: Él prefiere no recibir notificaciones por correo.

sideB.text: He prefers not to receive email notifications.
He prefers to not receive notifications by email.
He'd rather not receive email notifications.
He prefers not to get email notifications.

cards.note:
**[188]**

In modern English, [to not receive] and [not to receive] are both perfectly acceptable and interchangeable.

~He doesn't prefers receiving email notifications~ is not valid because the auxiliary [doesn't] must be followed by the [base verb] 'prefer' (without the 's').

cards.sideA: Intenta no borrar los archivos temporales aún.

sideB.text: Try not to delete the temporary files yet.
Please try to not delete the temp files just yet.
Try to avoid deleting the temporary files for now.

cards.note:
**[188]**

~Try don't delete~ is a common error; always use [not to] or [to not] when negating an infinitive.

cards.sideA: Podemos usar o React o Vue para este proyecto.

sideB.text: We can use either React or Vue for this project.
Either React or Vue can be used for this project.
We have the option of using either React or Vue.

cards.note:
**[189]**

[Either... or] is the correct structure for presenting a choice between two available alternatives.

cards.sideA: Necesitamos una biblioteca para gestionar los popup.

sideB.text: We need a library to manage the popups.
We require a library to handle the popups.
A library is needed to manage pop-up windows.

cards.sideA: La biblioteca verifica la versión en la tienda.

sideB.text: The library checks the version in the store.
The library verifies the version on the app store.
This library is used to check for the store version.
The library verifies the version in the store.
The library verifies the version on the store.

cards.sideA: Esa biblioteca permite forzar la actualización.

sideB.text: That library allows forcing the update.
That library enables us to force an update.
That library makes it possible to force the update.

cards.note:
**[13]**



~That library allows to force~ is grammatically incorrect. The verb 'allow' must be followed by an Object + Infinitive ([allows us to force]) or a Gerund ([allows forcing]). It cannot be followed directly by 'to'.

cards.sideA: Debemos configurar la biblioteca en el proyecto.

sideB.text: We must configure the library in the project.
We need to set up the library within the project.
The library needs to be configured in the project.
We must configure the project library.

cards.note: ~We must set the library~ is incomplete. In this context, you need the phrasal verb [set up] or the verb [configure]. 'Set' alone usually means to establish a value or place an object.

cards.sideA: La biblioteca muestra un mensaje de descarga.

sideB.text: The library shows a download message.
The library displays a message for downloading.
This library prompts the user with a download message.

cards.note: ~The library shows a downloaded message~ changes the meaning. [Downloaded] implies the message itself was retrieved from a server, whereas [download message] refers to a notification about a download process.

cards.sideA: Lo dejé ahí por si acaso.

sideB.text: I left it there just in case.
I kept it there in case I need it later.
I put it there just as a precaution.

cards.sideA: Dejé esa línea de código comentada ahí por si acaso.

sideB.text: I left that line commented out, just in case.
I kept that line of code commented there just in case.
I left that line of code as a comment there just in case.
I left that commented line, just in case.
I left that line with a comment, just in case.

cards.sideA: Me faltan 5 dolares.

sideB.text: I'm missing 5 dollars.
I'm 5 dollars short.
I need 5 dollars more.

cards.sideA: Me faltan algunos datos aun

sideB.text: I'm still missing some data.
I still lack some information.
Some data is still missing.
I still lack some data.

cards.note: ~I lack still some information~ has incorrect word order. The adverb [still] must be placed before the main verb: [I still lack].

cards.sideA: Son diferentes niveles de EBS.

sideB.text: They are different EBS levels.
These are various levels of EBS.
Those represent different levels within EBS.
They are different levels of EBS.
They are different levels in EBS.

cards.note: ~They are different leveles in EBS~ is invalid due to the spelling error in [levels].

cards.sideA: Así nos aseguramos que las fechas y mensajes en francés son correctos.

sideB.text: This way, we make sure the dates and messages in French are correct.
This ensures that dates and messages in French are accurate.
That's how we verify that the French dates and messages are right.
This way, we ensure the dates and messages in French are correct.
That way, we ensure the dates and messages in French are correct.

cards.sideA: Envía todos los datos solo en 1 llamada.

sideB.text: It sends all the data in a single call.
It transmits all the information in just one call.
All data is sent using only one request.
It sends all the data in just one call.
It sends all the data in just a single call.

cards.note:
~It sends all the data just in one call~ sounds unnatural. The adverb 'just' should modify the quantity 'one', so the correct order is [in just one call].

~It sends all the data just in a single call~ is slightly awkward. The adverb 'just' should be placed right before the quantity it emphasizes: [in just a single call].

cards.sideA: En vez de hacer 3 llamadas, lo hacemos todo en 1.

sideB.text: Instead of making three separate calls, we handle everything in one.
Rather than performing three calls, we do it all in a single one.
We're processing everything in one go instead of three calls.

cards.sideA: Debemos establecerlo manualmente.

sideB.text: We must set it manually.
We have to configure it by hand.
It needs to be established manually.

cards.sideA: Este es el guardián de seguridad en el paquete.

sideB.text: This is the security gatekeeper within the package.
This acts as the security guard for the package.
This is the security gatekeeper inside the package.
This is the security guard in the package.

cards.note:
~This is the security guard of the package~ is grammatically correct but sounds a bit robotic. In technical English, using [for the package] or a noun adjunct like [package security guard] is more natural.

~This is the guard of security in the package~ is unnatural because 'guard of security' is a literal translation. Use the compound noun [security guard].

cards.sideA: Los datos y las fechas deben ser correctos.

sideB.text: The data and the dates must be correct.
Information and dates have to be accurate.
Data and dates need to be correct.

cards.sideA: Impide la fuga de información entre provincias.

sideB.text: It prevents data leakage between provinces.
It stops information from leaking between provinces.
It blocks data leaks across different provinces.
It prevents data leak between provinces.
It prevents data leakage among provinces.
It prevents the leak of information between provinces.

cards.sideA: Es un parser customizado desde inglés al francés.

sideB.text: It's a custom parser from English to French.
It is a customized parser for translating English to French.
This is a custom-built parser for English to French conversion.
It is a custom parser from English to French.

cards.sideA: Inicializa al usuario en EBS.

sideB.text: It initializes the user in EBS.
It sets up the user within EBS.
It performs the user initialization in EBS.

cards.note: ~Initialize the user in EBS~ is an imperative command (an order). Since the source sentence describes what the system does (Third Person), the correct form requires a subject: [It initializes] the user.

cards.sideA: Traduce el tipo de payment, ya sea en inglés o francés.

sideB.text: It translates the payment type, whether in English or French.
It handles the translation of the payment type into English or French.
It converts the payment type, regardless of it being in English or French.
It translates the kind of payment, whether in English or French.
It translates the payment type, either in English or French.
Translate the payment type, whether in English or French.

cards.sideA: Es una función para establecer el idioma y la fecha.

sideB.text: It's a function to set the language and the date.
This function is used to establish the language and date context.
It serves as a function for setting the language and date parameters.
The function is meant to set language and date.
The function is to set language and date.

cards.sideA: Es la API que se usa actualmente en la parte web.

sideB.text: It's the API currently used in the web section.
This is the API being used on the web side.
It's the API that is currently utilized in the web tier.
It's the API used currently in the web side.
It's the current API used in the web section.

cards.sideA: Enviamos todo junto para rendimiento y velocidad.

sideB.text: We send everything together for performance and speed.
We're bundling everything to optimize performance and velocity.
Everything is sent in bulk to improve speed and performance.

cards.sideA: La aplicación mobile sabe ocultar las filas que comienzan con #.

sideB.text: The mobile app knows how to hide rows starting with #.
The mobile application is designed to hide rows prefixed with #.
Rows beginning with # are automatically hidden by the mobile app.
The mobile app knows how to hide rows that start with #.

cards.note: ~The mobile app knows how to hide rows that starts with #~ is incorrect because 'rows' is plural, so the verb must be [start] without the 's'.

cards.sideA: UNION ALL permite unir las provincias, con la versión y mensaje de mantención.

sideB.text: UNION ALL allows joining the provinces with the version and maintenance message.
We use UNION ALL to merge provinces along with the version and maintenance notice.
UNION ALL enables the combination of provinces alongside version and maintenance info.

cards.sideA: Ahí estamos usando el procedimiento para establecer el idioma.

sideB.text: There, we are using the procedure to set the language.
We're utilizing the procedure to establish the language at that point.
That is where we use the procedure for language initialization.

cards.sideA: Al ser un procedimiento público, necesitamos establecerlo de esa manera.

sideB.text: Since it's a public procedure, we need to set it that way.
As it is a public procedure, it must be established accordingly.
Because the procedure is public, we have to define it as such.
As a public procedure, we need to set it that way.

cards.sideA: Es público porque aun el usuario no está logueado en la app.

sideB.text: It's public because the user isn't logged into the app yet.
It is public as the user has not yet authenticated in the application.
Since the user isn't signed in yet, it remains public.
It's public because the user isn't logged in the app yet.

cards.note:
~It's public because of the user isn't logged into the app yet~ is incorrect because 'because of' must be followed by a noun or gerund, not a full clause. 

~It's public because the user isn't logging into the app yet~ is invalid because the continuous form 'logging' suggests an ongoing process rather than the status of being [logged in].

cards.sideA: Solo por si acaso.

sideB.text: Just in case.
Just as a precaution.
Simply to be safe.

cards.sideA: Esta función verifica la autentificación del usuario, como sus tokens.

sideB.text: This function verifies user authentication, such as their tokens.
This function checks the user's authentication and tokens.
The purpose of this function is to validate user auth and tokens.
This function verifies user authentication, like their tokens.

cards.sideA: Y luego inicializa al usuario en EBS.

sideB.text: And then it initializes the user in EBS.
It subsequently sets up the user within EBS.
After that, it performs the user initialization in EBS.

cards.sideA: Este cambio es para resolver el bug de cantidad en return items.

sideB.text: This change is to fix the quantity bug in return items.
This modification addresses the quantity issue within return items.
We made this change to resolve the amount bug in the return items section.
This change is to fix the bug of quantity in return items.

cards.sideA: Si el resultado es nulo, retornamos 1.

sideB.text: If the result is null, we return 1.
It's a fallback; if it's null, we return 1.
We return 1 as a fallback in case the result is null.

cards.sideA: Si ninguna condición se cumple, retornamos ese valor.

sideB.text: If no conditions are met, we return that value.
We return that value as a fallback if no condition is satisfied.
In the event that no conditions match, we return that specific value.
If none of the conditions are met, we return that value.

cards.note:
**[190]**

~If none conditions are met~ is incorrect because 'none' is a pronoun. Use the determiner [no] before the noun 'conditions'.

~If any conditions are met, we return that value~ is incorrect because it changes the meaning to the opposite of the original sentence. To express that zero conditions were satisfied, use [no conditions] or [none of the conditions].

cards.sideA: Ahora retornamos la cantidad correcta en el dropdown de cada producto.

sideB.text: Now we return the correct quantity in each product's dropdown.
We are now returning the right amount for the dropdown of every product.
The correct quantity is now returned within the product dropdowns.
Now we return the correct quantity in the dropdown of each product.

cards.sideA: Ahora el dropdown de cantidad, es igual que en el catálogo.

sideB.text: Now the quantity dropdown is the same as in the catalog.
The quantity dropdown now matches the one in the catalog.
We have aligned the quantity dropdown with the catalog version.
Now the quantity dropdown is equal to the catalog.
Now the quantity dropdown is equal to the one in the catalog.

cards.sideA: Ahora el catalogo, cart y return items funcionan igual en sus cantidades.

sideB.text: Now the catalog, cart, and return items work the same regarding quantities.
Catalog, cart, and return items now share the same quantity logic.
Quantities now function consistently across the catalog, cart, and return items.
Now the catalog, cart, and return items work identically in their quantities.
Now the catalog, cart, and return items work in the same way regarding quantities.
Now the catalog, cart, and return items work with the same quantity logic.
Now the catalog, cart, and return items work the same regarding their quantities.

cards.note: ~Now the catalog, cart, and return items work the same as their quantities~ is incorrect because 'as their quantities' implies a comparison between the items and the quantities themselves. Use [regarding] or [in terms of] to specify the category of comparison.

cards.sideA: Solo cambiamos la última parte con un fallback.

sideB.text: We only changed the last part with a fallback.
Only the final section was modified to include a fallback.
We just updated the last part to add a fallback mechanism.

cards.sideA: Estamos usando el profile correcto para usar o el order date o delivery date.

sideB.text: We're using the correct profile to use either the order date or delivery date.
We are utilizing the right profile for choosing between order and delivery dates.
The appropriate profile is being used to select either the order or delivery date.

cards.sideA: Order date o sysdate es como lo mismo en este caso.

sideB.text: Order date or sysdate are practically the same in this case.
In this scenario, order date and sysdate are essentially interchangeable.
Order date or sysdate function similarly within this context.

cards.note:
~Order date or sysdate are like the same in this case~ is very informal and redundant. Use [practically the same] or [essentially the same] instead of 'like the same'.

~Order date or sysdate are like the same in this case~ is redundant even in informal speech. While understood, [practically the same] or [essentially the same] are the standard ways to express this near-equality.

~Order date or sysdate are the same~ contains a subject-verb agreement error. When using 'or' with singular nouns, the verb should be singular (is), or use 'and' to make it plural [Order date and sysdate are the same].

cards.sideA: Esa lógica es para buscar productos con el profile correcto.

sideB.text: That logic is intended for searching products with the correct profile.
We use that logic to find products using the right profile.
That specific logic handles product search using the appropriate profile.
That logic is to search products with the correct profile.

cards.sideA: Usamos o el sysdate o el request date según la provincia.

sideB.text: We use either sysdate or the request date depending on the province.
Depending on the province, we utilize either sysdate or the request date.
Either sysdate or the request date is used, based on the specific province.
We use either sysdate or the request date based on the province.

cards.note: ~We use either sysdate or the request date depend on the province~ is incorrect because 'depend' must be used as the participle [depending] when functioning as a connector.

cards.sideA: Esa lógica es para buscar productos en la lupa.

sideB.text: That logic is for searching products in the magnifying glass section.
We use that logic to search for items within the search icon.
That's the logic for the search functionality represented by the magnifying glass.
That logic is to search items in the magnifying glass.

cards.sideA: En la sección de la lupa no estábamos usando correctamente el profile.

sideB.text: In the search section, we weren't using the profile correctly.
We weren't correctly utilizing the profile within the magnifying glass area.
The profile was not being applied properly in the search functionality.
In the magnifying glass section, we weren't using the right profile.

cards.note: ~We hadn't used...~ uses the Past Perfect tense. The Spanish sentence uses the Past Continuous ("no estábamos usando"), so the correct translation is [We were not using...].

cards.sideA: Son las condiciones necesarias para obtener el dato.

sideB.text: These are the necessary conditions to retrieve the data.
They are the conditions required to fetch the information.
Those represent the mandatory conditions for obtaining the data point.
These are the necessary conditions to get the data.

cards.sideA: Removimos la inicialización por ser redundante.

sideB.text: We removed the initialization because it was redundant.
Initialization was no longer needed there, so we now use the function.
We deleted the redundant initialization and replaced it with the function call.
We removed the initialization for being redundant.

cards.note:
**[82]**

~We removed the initialization duo to it was redundant~ is not valid because 'due to' (not duo) must be followed by a noun or gerund, whereas 'because' is followed by a clause [Subject + Verb].

cards.sideA: Este cambio es para manejar correctamente la unión de líneas en el carrito.

sideB.text: This change is to correctly handle the merging of cart lines.
This modification ensures cart lines are merged properly.
We implemented this to manage cart line merging according to business rules.

cards.sideA: Dependiendo de la provincia, los productos iguales se juntan o se mantienen separados.

sideB.text: Depending on the province, identical products are either merged or kept separate.
Identical items are grouped or split based on the specific province's rules.
Same items may be aggregated or listed individually depending on the regional profile.
Depending on the province, the same products are merged or kept separate.

cards.note: ~Depending on the province, same products are merged or kept separate~ requires the article [the]. ~Depending on the province, identical products are either merged or keep separate~ is incorrect because the second verb must also be in the past participle [kept] to maintain the passive structure.

cards.sideA: Usamos el parámetro p_combinesameitem para controlar si se agrupan los items.

sideB.text: We use the p_combinesameitem parameter to control item grouping.
The p_combinesameitem flag is used to manage whether items are combined.
We're utilizing the p_combinesameitem parameter to determine if same items should merge.
We use the p_combinesameitem parameter to control merged items.
We use the p_combinesameitem parameter to control if items are merged.

cards.sideA: La lógica se basa en el profile IBE_SC_MERGE_SHOPCART_LINES.

sideB.text: The logic is based on the IBE_SC_MERGE_SHOPCART_LINES profile option.
We're following the IBE_SC_MERGE_SHOPCART_LINES profile configuration.
This behavior is driven by the IBE_SC_MERGE_SHOPCART_LINES profile settings.
The logic is based on the profile IBE_SC_MERGE_SHOPCART_LINES.

cards.sideA: Unir las líneas mejora la legibilidad del pedido para el cliente.

sideB.text: Merging lines improves order readability for the customer.
Grouping items makes the order easier for the client to read.
We aggregate lines to provide a cleaner view of the order for the user.

cards.note: ~Merge lines improves order readability for the customer~ is incorrect because a verb acting as a subject must be in the gerund form: [Merging lines].

cards.sideA: Actualizamos el llamado a AddItemsToCart para incluir la lógica de combinación.

sideB.text: We updated the AddItemsToCart call to include the merging logic.
The AddItemsToCart procedure call now supports item combination.
We've modified how we call AddItemsToCart to handle same-item merging.
We updated the AddItemsToCart call to include the merging logic.

cards.note: ~We updated the AddItemsToCart call to include the merged logic~ is incorrect. You should use [merging logic] to describe the logic that performs the action, or [merge logic] as a compound noun.

cards.sideA: Incluso si se agregan en momentos diferentes, algunos perfiles deben juntarlos.

sideB.text: Even if added at different times, some profiles must merge them.
Certain profiles require items to be grouped even if added separately.
Items added at different moments are aggregated according to the specific profile.
Even if they are added in different moments, some profiles must merge them.

cards.sideA: Pasamos G_MISS_CHAR para respetar el valor configurado en el perfil.

sideB.text: We pass G_MISS_CHAR to respect the value configured in the profile.
Using G_MISS_CHAR allows the API to default to the profile's setting.
We use G_MISS_CHAR so the system follows the IBE_SC_MERGE_SHOPCART_LINES profile behavior.

cards.sideA: Esta lógica asegura que el sistema respete las reglas de negocio locales.

sideB.text: This logic ensures the system follows local business rules.
This implementation makes sure we comply with regional business requirements.
We're doing this to align the application with local business policies.
This logic ensures the system follows business rules locally.
This logic ensures the system respects local business rules.

cards.sideA: El cambio afecta tanto a la creación como a la actualización del carrito.

sideB.text: The change affects both the creation and update of the cart.
This modification impacts procedures for adding items and creating quotes.
We've updated the logic within both the creation and addition procedures.

cards.note: ~The change affects to the creation...~ is incorrect because the verb 'affect' is transitive and does not use the preposition 'to'. You should say [The change affects the creation...].

cards.sideA: El procedimiento ADD ITEM TO CART esta deprecado.

sideB.text: The ADD_ITEM_TO_CART procedure is deprecated.
The ADD_ITEM_TO_CART procedure has been deprecated.
The ADD_ITEM_TO_CART procedure is legacy and should no longer be used.
The procedure ADD_ITEM_TO_CART is deprecated.

cards.sideA: Eliminamos el hardcode 'US' por la variable local.

sideB.text: We removed the 'US' hardcode for the local variable.
We replaced the hardcoded 'US' with the local variable.
The 'US' hardcode was removed in favor of the local variable.

cards.sideA: Y como puse ahi, es util para debugear.

sideB.text: And as I mentioned there, it's useful for debugging.
And as I put there, it's helpful for debugging purposes.
And like I stated there, it is useful for debugging.

cards.sideA: Solo son espacios en blanco.

sideB.text: They are just blank spaces.
It's just whitespace.
Those are only empty spaces.
They are just white spaces.

cards.sideA: Ahi estamos obteniendo el CONVERSION RATE, para generar el quantity de return items.

sideB.text: There, we are getting the CONVERSION RATE to generate the return items quantity.
We are obtaining the CONVERSION RATE there to calculate the quantity for return items.
In that section, we fetch the CONVERSION RATE to generate the return item quantity.

cards.sideA: Necesitamos esos datos en el frontend.

sideB.text: We need that data on the frontend.
We require those data points in the frontend.
That data is needed for the frontend.
We need those data on the frontend.

cards.sideA: Necesitamos esos valores en el frontend.

sideB.text: We need those values on the frontend.
Those values are required in the frontend.
We must have those values available on the frontend side.

cards.sideA: Si vas arriba, veras la variable local.

sideB.text: If you go up, you will see the local variable.
You can see the local variable if you look above.
Scroll up and you'll find the local variable.
If you scroll up, you will see the local variable.

cards.sideA: Si vas mas abajo, veras el cursor.

sideB.text: If you go further down, you will see the cursor.
Further down, you'll find the cursor.
You can see the cursor if you keep scrolling down.

cards.sideA: Si vas abajo, veras las condiciones en el where.

sideB.text: If you go down, you'll see the conditions in the where clause.
You can find the where conditions further down.
Check below to see the conditions in the where statement.

cards.sideA: Si vas mas arriba, veras el llamado a la funcion.

sideB.text: If you go further up, you will see the function call.
Further up, you can see where the function is called.
Look further above to find the function call.
If you go further up, you will see the call to the function.
If you scroll further up, you will see the call to the function.

cards.sideA: Antes se enviaba todo por el uso de *, ahora solo lo que necesitamos.

sideB.text: Before, everything was sent using *, now only what we need.
Previously, the * was used to send everything; now we only send necessary data.
We used to send everything via *, but now we only include what's required.

cards.sideA: Creo que se llama alias de tabla temporal.

sideB.text: I think it's called a temporary table alias.
I believe it's referred to as a temp table alias.
It is likely called a temporary table alias.

cards.sideA: Ya no hay necesidad de usar inicializaciones si usamos a la funcion GET_ICX_USER_ID.

sideB.text: There is no longer a need for initializations if we use the GET_ICX_USER_ID function.
Using the GET_ICX_USER_ID function eliminates the need for initializations.
We don't need to use initializations anymore if we call the GET_ICX_USER_ID function.
There is no need for initializations if we use the GET_ICX_USER_ID function.

cards.sideA: Estos cambios fueron hechos mayormente por Sean.

sideB.text: These changes were mostly made by Sean.
Sean was responsible for most of these changes.
These modifications were primarily done by Sean.
These changes were made mostly by Sean.

cards.note: ~These changes were made in their majority by Sean~ is unnatural. Use [mostly] or [primarily] instead.

cards.sideA: Se cambio a la api de ISTORE para ahora manejar el item merging.

sideB.text: It was changed to the ISTORE API to now handle item merging.
We switched to the ISTORE API to manage item merging now.
The ISTORE API is now being used to handle item merging.

cards.sideA: Comente esas lineas, pero no las borre, por si acaso.

sideB.text: I commented out those lines but didn't delete them, just in case.
Those lines were commented out instead of deleted, just in case.
I kept those lines as comments rather than deleting them, just as a precaution.

cards.sideA: Es solo un salto de linea, para mejor legibilidad.

sideB.text: It's just a line break for better readability.
That's only a newline for improved legibility.
It is simply a line break to make it easier to read.
It's just a line break to improve readability.

cards.sideA: Fue un cambio mayor el que hicimos.

sideB.text: It was a major change that we made.
We implemented a significant change.
The modification we performed was a major one.
What we made was a major change.

cards.note:
**[63]**

~What we made It was a major change~ is incorrect because 'It' is redundant. Use the noun clause [What we made was a major change].

cards.sideA: Es solo un cambio menor.

sideB.text: It's just a minor change.
This is only a slight modification.
It is merely a minor adjustment.

cards.sideA: Obtener y validar son cosas distintas.

sideB.text: Fetching and validating are different things.
Getting and validating are two distinct actions.
Retrieving data is not the same as validating it.
Retrieving and validating are different things.

cards.sideA: Esas son las nuevas reglas o condiciones que se requieren.

sideB.text: Those are the new rules or conditions that are required.
These are the mandatory new rules and conditions.
Those represent the new requirements or conditions.
Those are the new rules or conditions required.

cards.sideA: France esta a cargo de eso.

sideB.text: France is in charge of that.
France is responsible for that task.
France handles that specifically.

cards.note: ~France is on charge of that~ is incorrect. The fixed expression is [in charge of].

cards.sideA: ¿Cual procedimiento es ese?

sideB.text: Which procedure is that?
What procedure are you referring to?
Which specific procedure is it?
What is that procedure?

cards.sideA: ¿De que procedimiento estamos hablando?

sideB.text: What procedure are we talking about?
Which procedure is being discussed?
Of which procedure are we speaking?
Which procedure are we talking about?

cards.sideA: En esta release, no hubo actualizacion de la especificacion.

sideB.text: In this release, there was no update to the specification.
There was no spec update for this release.
The specification was not updated in this release.
In this release, there was no update of the specification.

cards.note:
**[190]**

~there was no update in the specification~ is less natural. The standard preposition for updates made to a document or system is [to] (e.g., an update to the policy).

cards.sideA: Como estamos usando la función GET_ICX_USER_ID, ya no necesitamos inicializar al usuario.

sideB.text: Since we are using the GET_ICX_USER_ID function, we no longer need to initialize the user.
Because we use the GET_ICX_USER_ID function, user initialization is no longer necessary.
As we're utilizing the GET_ICX_USER_ID function, initializing the user is no longer required.
As we are using the GET_ICX_USER_ID function, we don't need to initialize the user anymore.

cards.sideA: Ya no necesitamos inicializar al usuario.

sideB.text: We no longer need to initialize the user.
There's no need to initialize the user anymore.
Initializing the user is no longer required.
We don't need to initialize the user anymore.

cards.sideA: Y la otra parte es un comentario eliminado.

sideB.text: And the other part is a removed comment.
The other section consists of a deleted comment.
And the remaining part is just a comment that was taken out.

cards.sideA: Ahí solo limpié el código.

sideB.text: I just cleaned up the code there.
I only performed some code cleanup.
All I did there was tidy up the code.

cards.sideA: Ahí solo borré el comentario.

sideB.text: I just removed the comment there.
I only deleted the comment.
I simply erased the comment in that section.

cards.sideA: Refactorizamos el código para extraer la lógica de sesión en una función independiente.

sideB.text: We refactored the code to extract the session logic into a separate function.
The code was refactored to pull the session logic into an independent function.
We've refactored to move the session logic to its own function.

cards.sideA: Este cambio hace que el código sea más fácil de mantener.

sideB.text: This change makes the code easier to maintain.
This modification improves code maintainability.
This update makes the code simpler to support in the future.

cards.sideA: Separamos la obtención de la sesión de la inicialización del entorno.

sideB.text: We separated session retrieval from environment initialization.
Session fetching has been decoupled from the environment setup.
We split getting the session from initializing the environment.
We separated the retrieval of the session from environment initialization.

cards.sideA: Ahora por un lado validamos la sesion y por otro inicializamos al usuario.

sideB.text: Now we validate the session on one hand and initialize the user on the other.
We are now validating the session and initializing the user separately.
The session validation and user initialization are now handled as separate tasks.

cards.sideA: ¿No se si Sean te explico algo sobre esto?

sideB.text: I'm not sure if Sean explained anything to you about this?
Did Sean mention anything to you regarding this?
Has Sean talked to you about this at all?

cards.sideA: ¿Esta la VPN con errores?

sideB.text: Is the VPN experiencing errors?
Are there issues with the VPN?
Is the VPN having some errors?

cards.note:
~Is the VPN with errors?~ and ~Is the VPN with down?~ are invalid. Use [Is the VPN down?] or [Are there errors with the VPN?].

~Is the VPN with errors?~ implies the VPN is carrying errors like an accessory. In English, we use the verb 'have' for possession of problems ([Does the VPN have errors?]) or 'be' for the state ([Is the VPN down?]).

cards.sideA: ¿Esta la VPN caida?

sideB.text: Is the VPN down?
Has the VPN crashed?
Is the VPN connection down?

cards.sideA: Es solo un avance.

sideB.text: It's just progress.
This is only a sneak peek.
It's merely an advancement.

cards.note:
**[29]**

~It's just a progress~ is invalid because [progress] is an uncountable noun and cannot use the article 'a'.

cards.sideA: Aqui solo cambiamos el nombre.

sideB.text: We only changed the name here.
All we did here was rename it.
The only change here was the name.
We are just changing the name here.

cards.sideA: Vamos a ensayar la instalacion completa.

sideB.text: We are going to do a dry run of the full installation.
We're going to rehearse the full install.
We'll run a smoke test for the complete installation.
We are going to test the complete installation.

cards.sideA: Entran todos en el resultado de la query.

sideB.text: All of them are included in the query result.
Everything is contained within the query output.
Every single one is returned by the query.
Everything is included in the query result.

cards.sideA: En el viernes se hará.

sideB.text: It will be done on Friday.
It's going to happen on Friday.
On Friday, it will be completed.

cards.note:
**[21]**

~It will be done in Friday~ is incorrect because days of the week require the preposition [on].

cards.sideA: En el Miércoles se hizo eso.

sideB.text: That was done on Wednesday.
It happened on Wednesday.
On Wednesday, that task was finished.
That was made on Wednesday.

cards.sideA: En 2 semanas mas vamos a hacerlo.

sideB.text: We are going to do it in two weeks.
We'll do it in two more weeks.
In two weeks' time, we're going to do it.
We are going to do it in two more weeks.

cards.sideA: En Febrero se supone que se hará.

sideB.text: It's supposed to be done in February.
It is expected to happen in February.
In February, it should be completed.

cards.sideA: En Marzo se realizara el release.

sideB.text: The release will take place in March.
In March, the release will happen.
The release is scheduled for March.
The release will be done in March.

cards.sideA: En el proximo año planeamos empezar con eso.

sideB.text: We plan to start with that next year.
Next year, we're planning to begin that.
In the coming year, we intend to start on that.
We plan to do that next year.

cards.note:
**[21]**

~on the next year~ is incorrect. Use [next year] without a preposition for calendar years, or [in the next year] to refer to the duration of the coming twelve months.
